title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: Contributing
text: Contributions autograph, whether form issue identification, bug fixes, new code documentation encouraged welcome.

title: Contributing
text: stocnet projects maintained using git version control system. plain-English introduction git can found . recommend read continuing. recent motivation can found . explain basics git version control, committing repos, pulling pushing, branching merging. Using git command line lap- desktop can intimidating, recommend Fork software Mac Windows. allows mostly visual management commits, diffs, branches, etc. various git software packages available, one fairly fully featured. Github page allows access issues assigned check commits. can also access documents repository, although won’t necessary cloned computer via Fork.

title: Contributing
text: Please use issues tracker Github identify function-related issues. can use issues track progress issue comment continue conversation issue. Currently issue tracking open involved project. useful issues ones precisely identify error, propose test pass instead fails. package uses testthat package testing functions. Please see testthat website details.

what: Bug fixing or adding new code
title: Contributing
text: Independent assigned code contributions welcome. writing new code, please follow standard R guidelines. can help use packages lintr, goodpractice formatR ensure followed. Currently, commits can pushed Bitbucket reference existing issue. issue exists code developed, please add issue first pushing. issue exists, need mention issue number (preceded hash symbol: #) commit description: Resolved #31 adding new function things, also updated documentation issue hash (.e. #31) preceded resolve, resolves, resolved, close, closes, closed, fix, fixes, fixed (capitalised ), Github automatically updated status issue(s) mentioned. current syntactical standard mention issue first provide short description committed changes relation issue. ancillary changes can mentioned comma.

title: Authors and Citation
text: James Hollway. Maintainer, author, contributor.            IHEID Henrique Sposito. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hollway J (2025). autograph: Automatic Plotting Many Graphs. R package version 0.1.2, https://stocnet.github.io/autograph/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {autograph: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs},   author = {James Hollway},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.2},   url = {https://stocnet.github.io/autograph/}, }

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: package aims make exploration, analysis, publication results stocnet packages easier, faster, consistent. letting simply set theme, say institution, palettes used whenever use plot() graphr() object created one relevant packages.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: easy set theme. Just type stocnet_theme() see theme currently set, get list available themes. enter chosen theme name
code: library(autograph) library(patchwork) stocnet_theme() #> ℹ Theme is set to default. #> ℹ The following themes are available: default, bw, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, crisp, neon, and rainbow. (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e"))) stocnet_theme("ethz") #> ✔ Theme set to ethz. (plot(node_degree(ison_karateka)) +  plot(tie_betweenness(ison_karateka)))/ (plot(node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")) +  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),      membership = node_in_regular(ison_southern_women, "e")))

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: easiest way install latest stable version autograph via CRAN. Simply open R console enter: install.packages('autograph') library(autograph) load package make data tutorials (see ) contained within package available.

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: latest development version, slightly earlier access new features testing, may wish download install binaries Github install source locally. latest binary releases major OSes – Windows, Mac, Linux – can found . Download appropriate binary operating system, install using adapted version following commands: Windows: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_winOS.zip", repos = NULL) Mac: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_macOS.tgz", repos = NULL) Unix: install.packages("~/Downloads/autograph_linuxOS.tar.gz", repos = NULL) install source latest main version autograph Github, please install remotes package CRAN : latest stable version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph") latest development version: remotes::install_github("stocnet/autograph@develop")

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: using Mac computers may also install using Macports: sudo port install R-autograph

title: Automatic Plotting of Many Graphs
text: Development package funded Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF) Grant Number 188976: “Power Networks Rate Change Institutional Complexes” (PANARCHIC).

title: Matching layout — layout_tbl_graph_matching
text: layout works position nodes opposite matching nodes. See manynet::to_matching() details matching procedure.

title: Matching layout — layout_tbl_graph_matching
code: layout_tbl_graph_matching(.data, center = NULL, circular = FALSE, times = 1)

title: Matching layout — layout_tbl_graph_matching
text: .data {manynet} compatible network data. center, circular, times Extra parameters required {tidygraph} compatibility.

title: Matching layout — layout_tbl_graph_matching
text: Returns table nodes' x y coordinates.

title: Precooked results for demonstrating plotting — made_earlier
text: object class netlm length 15. object class network_test length 9. object class diffs_model (inherits data.frame) 20 rows 11 columns. object class diff_model (inherits tbl_df, tbl, data.frame) 4 rows 10 columns. object class sienaGOF length 1. object class influenceTable (inherits data.frame) 25 rows 4 columns. object class selectionTable (inherits data.frame) 25 rows 4 columns. object class traces.monan length 3. object class gof.stats.monan length 2.

what: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
title: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
text: functions plot distributions node, tie, network measures, defined {manynet} package.

title: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
code: # S3 method for class 'node_measure' plot(x, type = c("h", "d"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'tie_measure' plot(x, type = c("h", "d"), ...)  # S3 method for class 'network_measures' plot(x, ...)

title: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
text: x object "node_measure", "tie_measure", "network_measures" class. type node tie measures, whether plot "h" histogram "d" density plot. default "h". ... arguments passed .

title: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
text: plot.node_measure() plot.tie_measure() returns histogram /density plot distribution measure. plot.network_measures() returns plot measure traced time.

title: Plotting logical marks Plotting numeric measures — map_measure
code: plot(manynet::node_deg(ison_karateka))  plot(manynet::tie_betweenness(ison_karateka))

title: Plotting categorical memberships — map_member
text: plotting method operates "node_member" class objects {manynet} package, plotting dendrogram membership.

title: Plotting categorical memberships — map_member
code: # S3 method for class 'node_member' plot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'matrix' plot(x, ..., membership = NULL)

title: Plotting categorical memberships — map_member
text: x object "node_member" class, example result running manynet::node_in_community(). ... arguments passed . membership "node_member" membership vector.

title: Plotting categorical memberships — map_member
text: plot.node_member() returns dendrogram, labels colored indicate different clusters, optimal cutpoint shown dashed highlight line. plot.matrix() returns plot adjacency incidency matrix, potentially rows columns reordered illustrate additional membership vector.

title: Plotting categorical memberships — map_member
code: plot(manynet::node_in_walktrap(ison_southern_women, "e"))  plot(as_matrix(ison_adolescents),   membership = node_in_walktrap(ison_adolescents, "e"))  plot(as_matrix(ison_southern_women),   membership = node_in_walktrap(ison_southern_women, "e"))

title: Plotting tabular motifs — map_motifs
text: functions plot graphs motifs used vector results e.g. triad census.

title: Plotting tabular motifs — map_motifs
code: # S3 method for class 'node_motif' plot(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'network_motif' plot(x, ...)

title: Plotting tabular motifs — map_motifs
text: x object "node_motif" class, e.g. resulting call manynet::node_by_triad(). ... arguments passed .

title: Plotting tabular motifs — map_motifs
text: plot.node_motif() returns set graphs illustrate motifs mentioned results node_motif function {manynet}. plot.network_motif() returns set graphs illustrate motifs mentioned results net_motif function {manynet}.

title: Many themes — map_themes
text: function enables plots quickly, easily consistently themed. achieved setting theme option enables appropriate palette used autograph-consistent plotting methods. following themes currently available: default, bw, iheid, ethz, uzh, rug, unibe, crisp, neon, rainbow.

title: Many themes — map_themes
code: stocnet_theme(theme = NULL)

title: Many themes — map_themes
text: theme String naming theme. default "default". string can capitalised .

title: Many themes — map_themes
text: function sets theme palette(s) used across stocnet packages. palettes written options held .

title: Many themes — map_themes
code: stocnet_theme("default") #> ✔ Theme set to default. plot(manynet::node_degree(ison_karateka))  stocnet_theme("rug") #> ✔ Theme set to rug. plot(manynet::node_degree(ison_karateka))

title: Matching colors across palettes — match_color
text: Sometimes particular colours coded certain ways facilitate interpretation. example, perhaps primary colours traffic light colours used represent discrete options. Yet institutional palettes vary terms colours available. function uses Euclidean distance colours CIELAB space target palette find closes corresponding colours.

title: Matching colors across palettes — match_color
code: match_color(colors, pal)

title: Matching colors across palettes — match_color
text: colors One hexcodes match colors palette. pal Optionally, vector hexcodes representing palette find matches. default, current theme's qualitative palette used.

title: Matching colors across palettes — match_color
text: vector hexcodes length first argument.
